Pre-Game Insights: The New York Yankees will continue their three-game series with the Chicago Cubs on Saturday at Wrigley Field.
Clarke Schmidt is returning from a months-long injury and will start for the Yankees.
Javier Assad will start for the Cubs, having had two straight quality starts.
The Yankees are still battling the Baltimore Orioles for first place in the American League East.
The Cubs entered the series trailing the final wildcard spot by four games.
Anthony Volpe has been solid as the leadoff hitter for the Yankees this season.
Juan Soto has been a welcome addition to the Yankees, on pace for at least 40 home runs and 100 RBIs.
Aaron Judge came into this series with 51 home runs, 124 RBIs, and 107 runs.
Nico Hoerner leads the Cubs in runs and will look to score more in this game.
Ian Happ has already passed 80 RBIs and 80 runs for the Cubs.
Cody Bellinger has regressed and will likely not cross 20 home runs or 80 RBIs this season.
